rules: Rule1: If a drug treatment is effective, then the drug treatment is approved.
Rule2: Either a drug treatment is effective or it is safe.
Rule3: Under the condition that a drug treatment is safe, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.
Rule4: Whenever a drug treatment is approved, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.
Rule5: Either funding is available through a grant or an institute has funding.

Rule6: Whenever a protocol requires approval, then if a regulator, the FDA, monitors, then if a drug treatment is effective, then if a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, it is not the case that the animal survives.
Rule7: If an advisor recommends continuation, then a board reviews data.
Rule8: Either an advisor recommends continuation or a consultant suggests modifications.
Rule9: Under the condition that a consultant suggests modifications, then it is not the case that a committee halts a trial.

Rule10: Provided that a regulator approves a trial by the FDA, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.
Rule11: Either a regulator approves a trial by the FDA or a researcher conducts an experiment.

Rule12: If a scientist analyzes data results, then if a researcher conducts an experiment, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.
Rule13: Either a scientist analyzes data results or a researcher publishes a paper with findings.

Rule14: Under the condition that a researcher publishes a paper with findings, then if a researcher conducts an experiment, then if a researcher tests on a mouse animal, then if an organization develops a drug in a company, then a researcher does not use a microscope.
Rule15: If a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse, then an animal survives.
Rule16: Either a veterinarian administers a drug to a mouse or an institute has funding.
Rule17: If it is not the case that either a lab has equipment in the form of a tool or funding is not available through a grant, then a company expands its facility.

Rule18: Under the condition that it is not the case that either a scientist receives an award or if a company expands its facility, then a team continues research, then a department terminates a project.
Rule19: Whenever it is not the case that a protocol requires approval, then a committee halts a trial.
Rule20: If an institute does not have funding, then a researcher uses a microscope.
facts: Fact1: A regulator, the FDA, monitors.
Fact2: An organization develops a drug in a company.
Fact3: A researcher tests on a mouse animal.
Fact4: A lab does not have equipment in the form of a tool.
Fact5: A team does not continue research.
Fact6: A scientist does not receive an award.
Fact7: A department does not terminate a project.
Fact8: A board does not review data.
